factText: #KincadeFire LARGE ANIMAL EVACUATION HELP: If you need help evacuating animals call Animal Services, 707-565-7100 or 707-565-7103. #KincadeFire Text or call 2-1-1 for #evacuation and #shelter information.

The 25,955-acre wildfire was 11% contained Saturday night. The Kincade Fire has burned 30,000 acres and is 10 percent contained, according to CAL FIRE. Kincade fire now 25,955 acres, 11% contained. The fire is 10% contained as of 10:15 a.m. The #KincadeFire currently at 5% containment after 54,000 acres have burned. factText: California Gov. Gavin Newsom declared a state emergency Sunday as crews continued to fight the Kincade and Tick fires. factText: I'm thankful for all those working their tails off without sleep trying to stop the Kincade fire and all those working to help with evacuations/public safety. We all hope the Kincade fire becomes contained and all stay safe.

factText: Meanwhile, heavy winds are creating a severe wildfire risk across Northern California. The current wildfire, dubbed the Kincade Fire, began Wednesday night and is only 10% contained, the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection said Sunday. Now, some 180,000 people are being asked to leave their homes in Northern California due to the fire. As of Sunday, approximately 180,000 people were under evacuation warnings from the Kincade Fire, according to the Sonoma County Sheriff. The fire has burned more than 30,000 acres and over 180,000 have evacuated the area.
All Sunday programming is canceled due to the #kincadefire.

factText: The power is out, there are severe gusts of wind, and a major fire is raging out in Sonoma County. High winds and fires have left over 2 million customers without power due to a power safety shutoff in Northern California. Local power company is planning to cut electricity to 940 homes and businesses to prevent more blaze.
Overnight and this morning we safely evacuated 110 patients from our Santa Rosa hospital to other Kaiser Permanente hospitals in Northern California due to the #KincadeFire.

factText: The northbound Antelope Valley Freeway, which had been closed between Golden Valley Road and Agua Dulce, was reopened about 4 p.m. Friday. All road closures were lifted this morning at 6 a.m. with the exception of Tick Canyon Road between Abelia Road and Summit Knoll Road, the last area remaining under mandatory evacuation. Hwy 101 between Santa Rosa and Cloverdale is in the process of being reopened to through traffic.

The fire, fueled by winds in the area that topped 93 mph, has already destroyed 79 structures, including at least 31 homes. The fire has burned more than 30,000 acres and has destroyed at least 77 structures including 31 homes and the landmark soda rock winery seen here.

Last night's winds made an already difficult situation all the more treacherous and 180,000 people have been forced to evacuate as the flames spread. Hundreds of thousands of Sonoma County residents were ordered to evacuate in the face of a massive wildfire.
